-FdGoFnXK9o58mAPGXGc0A.text: Really tasty proper Italian food. Very busy and lively atmosphere. Wonderful steaks but can be a little pricey - especially the daily specials etc. It has a great vibe and the waiting style is old school, which means the waiters are attentive and charming.

boG667LzngDoEV0AXb2tMg.text: This is the best Italian I've ever had. I was taken here by an Italian friend, so that's definitely saying something. The place felt unpretentious and genuine. The pasta dishes are amazing. I had some sort of scallop and linguine dish. Scallops were done perfectly. The pasta was the right texture and flavorful. The pizza is also good. I'm not sure how it stacks up against other London pizzas, but there's a lot of good pizza in New York so it was less special.The desserts were as outstanding as the pasta. I tried the tiramisu and the profiteroles. Both were delicious, but also had a nice, fresh, and light texture (even though calorie-wise I'm sure it's not).

QjFgM4s13pa2fZIq7RFpTg.text: Their Calzone pizza is one of the few good ones in this area. I have tried it twice and it was nearly as good as it is in Italy

dkdNkDmJq3Y9ABtzbDIKDw.text: A fine Italian restaurant blessed with an abundance of specials. Its a bit pricier than most Italian restaurants, but then you must take the location into account. The food is very good and there are many options, so you won't find yourself trawling through a menu only to decide on pizza - again. The monk fish is certainly worth a try. Even better than the food is the service. The staff are friendly and helpful should you ask for advice with your selection. If it's someones birthday then discreetly let the staff know and your friend will soon have the whole restaurant singing happy birthday to him/her and then will be presented with a desert from their fine selection, and a candle to blow out... Very good.

xjUHQU2mcAc-8XCZaROwNQ.text: They have the best pasta in London. My colleague kept on telling me how great this place was, so one day I went there and was completely convinced. The portion was generous, the sauce was just about right - not too watery or gravy, and the pasta itself was cooked right to the al dente stage. The restaurant is a bit out of city, still, it was packed when I visited. After the meal, I even asked for a name card so that I could refer this to friends without forgetting its name.

JejOEykfg2IBGuPPdXwTbQ.text: Now, Wapping really is not blessed by a big choice of restaurants, but the one I know is perfect if you live around there and are not bothered to cook in the evening or if you are someone who made all the way to St. Katharine Docklands - Wapping is not far away.It is a Italian restaurant with lots of little tables. It is a really good place for a quick pizza or pasta. The service is very friendly, funny, quick and the place seems to be packed all the time, even on a Sunday night at 10pm. It is one of the best Italian I know and I would recommend going there in a bigger group, it is not the best place to have a romantic tête-à-tête. The portions are huge which explains the prices, for me a main would have been enough, but I had to finish it!

5PHWJtA5o2aTgkaiayQZUA.text: This place although not old in terms of decor and  interior atmosphere has a very oldy worldy feel - and that is because of the waiters!!They all seem to be of a certain age with a certain accent and have certain type of manners --and for this reason you always feel pampered when you go in here .The cuisine is italien and the portions are mammath --in fact sometimes too big - a plate of mussels is like a tray and you are give a huge bowl to deposit your shells in --The pizzas and calamari portions are also generous -- but where they really go crazy is on the deserts - they are obscene !! ,italien ice cream, tiramisu , cream  and more cream --the works -- The service is from a different world -- and very nice -- they are especially also child friendly, although restaurant is quite "adult".This is a very nice place to go as a group or take the parents --something about is reassuring and italien .

6rrOOi3phA6mkRh2RAG-pg.text: It was a fantastic meal .Sadly it is thery full there .The Service is not so nice .

GNc7Ed15UVrTf9ik9cPxCg.text: I used to go here all the time when I lived in Wapping. I've now moved away, but love to go back for great food, great atmosphere and great service.As a previous poster has said, the portions are BIG so it's best not to eat too much in the day before you go!

mvSoxYJ031hD0ctTVtE5Aw.text: Fantastic place, just been there for my birthday dinner and can honestly (if slighty tipsily) say that the pizza was one of the best I've ever had. Have been to Italy many times and not enjoyed a pizza as much as tonight. Side salad was beautifully fresh and even the tomato sauce on the pizza tasted 100% authentic. Mum had delicious mussels in a creamy tomato sauce and the clams in my Dad's spaghetti vongolé were fantastic. Topped off with a glass of champagne and a huge slab of very indulgent tiramisu, a friendly and knowledgeable waiter and a busy, local atmosphere, I can't fault it.

ystGKKq0YcNy0SDAM_1IXg.text: Authentic Italian with an acceptable price. Very good minestrone and pasta here. I love it.

PmHWpmezojuvpylo8E2roQ.text: Il Bordello is a really good place for a quick pizza or pasta. The service is very friendly and quick and the place seems to be packed all the time, even on a Sunday night at 10pm. Menu also has a good selection of meat and fish but prices are high, although portions are HUGE. As I said the place is busy so may not suit a quiet romantic meal, but if your in Wapping give it a go.

Fu5jH9esFIjfChGZr0GyZQ.text: Amazing place to eat. Pasta is truly Italian and they make a brilliant lobster

hURQcDpXJ6sU22iVvqcagA.text: Fantastic Italian food at reasonable price. Can't get a reservation so just got take away and ate at home. Great linguine pescatora and ravioli, no complaints!

cBM8sIKI9bkf8fEysD8aUA.text: This place is a Wapping institution having been here for as long as I can recall. Although slightly on the expensive side, the food is very good and service friendly and efficient. A pretty good place to come to as a group for an evening out.

cdn3U8kKQRaw0MYNJTRjTA.text: Small bustling restaurant that does amazing Italian. The decor is nothing fancy, but the restaurant has a lot of charm.  Came here on a Sunday evening with friends. Would definitely recommend a booking since the place is small. But don't let the small interior fool you, the food portions are large.  Everything from their pizzas to pastas was well done and enough to take away for a late night snack.  Favs on the table that night were the gnocchi quattro formaggio and pollo cacciatora.  If this rating was solely based on the food it would definitely be five stars. Minus one star is for our first waiter that gave my friend a dirty look when she asked for parmesian cheese on her cacciatora. Ya, our whole table saw it- rude. Anyways, maybe it was the end of his shift or whatever. Second waiter was much nicer.

QTytfiHw9FY4kcqbaRtJYg.text: This place is incredible. If you've ever had real (not Olive Garden) Italian food this place is for you. The smell alone will make you salivate. I had the gazpacho, bruschetta and crabmeat ravioli and they were absolutely perfect

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Gazpacho - Incredible and Flavorful
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Bruschetta - Fresh and Delicious
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Crabmeat Ravioli - Amazing

yMRUBmzvRtD1GgwrDHOpPw.text: Been here so many times that I cant remember them all. However, the food has been outstanding every time and the place is not stingy with portion size. Don't be fooled with getting an appetiser beforehand because you will surely struggle to finish your main. Desserts...Heaven! Staff very welcoming. Best Italian in London!

lstzsJzPpPR2ohvDJZuCfw.text: Good old fashioned Italian food. The tables for two are so close together that I actually joined someone else's date last week! The waiters are lovely and the portions are huge. The food is delicious - no matter what we order, it ends up being really tasty, full of garlic and oh so filling. I have never actually finished a whole plateful there! The manager is a bit surly, but you simply have to laugh when he stares at you blankly. (hence one star lost)

R7HVhtdtJ6CPfwllS00C3A.text: Nice family restaurant the service was very good and the food was to die for had the fish platter for the first time and was 5 stars.

waaEvcCqnh6d5uXhthlcZg.text: The service is very quick and attentive, food is very tasty and infused with the correct flavours.

2G89jZ5cWv_-VdOI1Dqx0Q.text: Excellent. Just excellent, best Italian restaurant I've found in London, by far. Not expensive (seafood is quite expensive but everything else isn't - pizzas between 10 and 14£, most main courses been 10 and 20). Grilled calamaris are unbelievable, lasagnas as well. I go to this place at least once a month, and I'm using them for pizzas takeaway as well. Also, good selection of wine (several good bottles under £20, the champagne at £36 is very good as well). Can't recommend Il Bordello enough! I recommend to book to avoid disappointment though.

8Ml7eeMddXT8RsQiUP_bIQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant in London.   It is off the beaten tourist track and serves amazing food.  I flew in early from Houston, TX for a business meeting just to eat here!

UDgMT6hZUYDUqcjNJUzZmQ.text: I have been going here for 10 years some of the waiters are still the same. The menu is classic with some specials on top. You will hear at least 3 birthday celebrations whole you are there so its lively but also good for dates. Food is well priced you could easily share a pizza and salad between two as portions are huge. Has not let me down yet and been about 30 times easily.

llWeI8WmWBnJdrwiybZbDw.text: We came here for our work team Christmas dinner and it was a very good setting for this.  There were about 30 of us and we were very well looked after.  The service was friendly and attentive and we didn't have long to wait in between our courses.The food was good and filling, but not what you would call fine dining.  I had a medium-cooked steak with mushroom sauce and it came with generous sides of roast potatoes and veges.It was a loud atmosphere, but felt appropriate for the restaurant.I wouldn't recommend for a dinner for two, but it was good for our team dinner.

TW2TsxPqVIwOehFxNRq5DQ.text: Very poor service filled my wine glass up to overflowing just so that they could take the bottle away!?! Plastic table clothes give it a cheap feel. Tables way too close together so you share the conversation as well as elbow space Only decent aspect is that the food was good but too expensive.I won't go back until something changes.

9P_2eEfIGR4dhNP4CAeW7w.text: It is good to see this place hasn't changed its excellent service.I left London in 2004 and we frequented Il Bordello every couple of months.Great food, big portions (this could be negative if you are calorie counting), fantastic profiterole, fantastic service with a side of flirt. I like the family style seating but that might not be everyone's cup.Always went home with a doggie bag and had leftovers the day after.Can't recommend highly enough!

NUurqbDyU_Es16yBka_dTQ.text: This place was highly recommended by a local guy we met at the nearby Captain Kidd pub.  We weren't sure what to expect, but we came hungry and were overwhelmed by the entire experience.  Food: delicious.  Best tiramisu ever.  Service: authentic. We felt lucky to have discovered this gem.

pUYT4auR5onULdd9vclV6Q.text: Good place, great service. This is an Italian place near our offices and I have had two meals here. Food is good, service is good.The pizza and tiramisu are definitely not to be missed.

gN7cu2p-v5O-cPtDYOGe5A.text: carb load heaven.  we thought it was quite the trek (from west london) and expected a life-changing experience.  we smelled garlic and olive oil a block away.  the pasta almost brought us back to rome.  my tagliatelle "special" was delivered by the server who didn't speak much english saying, "yummy, yummy, yummy."it's not fine dining...it's an italian restaurant - loud, happy, and bathed in the scent of yumminess. come hungry.

HUjFl1ItiA4xb0wGL3dO2g.text: This place has been around forever. Generous portions. Delicious pastas and pizzas.  The meats and fish mains aren't as good.  But definitely go for the pastas and pizzas

DXHORE5qnHjYR9rOpdsp6Q.text: This is a great italian restaurant, either for pizza, pasta and dessert. I'm italian: this is one of the nicest italian places in London for variety and choice.DISHESI went there a few times now, and I've tested a few different dishes.1. The pasta is usually very abundant and rich in taste. It usually resemble closely what you could find in Italy.2. The pizza isn't perfect, probably due to the electric oven. However it's pretty close and has good ingredients, without any excess..3. The desserts are really good, even if the tiramisu is a bit more bland than the italian counterpart it's still quite notable.4. The limoncello is also good, maybe a little too pricey but you can do it once in a while for a good one.AMBIENT AND SERVICEThe ambient feels like a good italian restaurant, and the service too. Cordial, attentive and prone to suggest you the best choice.Maybe it would be better if the tables were a bit more far away, but since I've always found it almost full I'm glad to be able to find a seat.A great place to feel almost in italy, great to have an amazing and abundant meal, without the trouble of choosing a good dish, since they are all great.

12AiZVYrqIDX_JcUUuaJfQ.text: Without a doubt the worst Italian restaurant I have ever eaten at. The service was not only poor, it was rude. Water glasses were never refilled, when my wife asked for water, her glass was filled, but mine remained empty. I ordered Calamari, and asked the waiter if I could have a small bowl of Tomato sauce to use for dipping, I was told No!... I could have Mayonnaise if I wanted, I'm Italian, I've never , ever even heard of that. My wife ordered the Salmon, it contained many small and several large bones. Sometimes a bone or two slips by, but this was over the top lack of attention. I saw the table next to ours ask the waiter for some bread, the reply was, bread is not free. The waiter was totally rude to them. The couple asked for the check, paid it and left, leaving their food half eaten. They were clearly upset. I should have left as soon as I was told no sauce for Calamari.  I would never return after seeing how they provide service. And the food rates one star at best

lrvX8R_UjPCeeDK5t4qc3w.text: Our daughters were craving Italian whilst on on visit to Lindon. I yelped a place close to us around Tower Bridge and ll Bordello came up. Took a taxi on over and was promptly seated. The Italian wait staff was friendly and recommended a couple dishes. We decided on seafood linguine, penne arribiata with grilled shrimp, mushroom pizza and a regular margarita pizza. Lemon sorbet for dessert. Everything was very good. Next time in London would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Penne arribiata
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Pasta with tomato sauce plus prawns
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Cheese pizza

d9WzdhxwZKSAjMow_3qHfQ.text: Il bordello is located in what felt like an older area of Wappings. I came here on a weeknight and there was absolutely no wait and most of the tables were actually empty. The restaurant itself has an old school Italian vibe to it as well as the service as well. Nothing super enthusiastic or extra friendly like how many modern places are. My fiancee and I decided to go for two pastas and went with a fettuccine alfredo dish and a tomato creamy spaghetti dish. Both of them were satisfying. Nothing truly standout but if you are in the area and want some pasta I wouldn't hesitate to drop by. Out of the two, I preferred the fettuccine alfredo dish but that may just be because I personally prefer creamy dishes. The tomato sauce dish was surprisingly a little spicy and had a nice little kick to it which was unexpected. The proportions were large and food was good so I can't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom

Y0lt0WD_OjMp4daKPGIsnA.text: This restaurant is a great italian spot andcozy and also serves huge portions. I've been here twice before and have ordered the Spahgetti Bolgonese and Garlic Pizza which is very delicious. If you are visting London this is a great spot that you must try.

cXqZ1RAoDD87aCOnYLzhcw.text: Wow. Fantastic dinner at Il Bordello. Great Italian, great ambiance, great portion size. You can literally smell and breathe the garlic when you walk in - and it smells so good!!! Have now eaten there a few times in the last few months and have sampled pizzas, pastas on the menu and it's all really impressive.

pe8mIuOWCLyh0xmXKrZJXw.text: The pizza was very good, the service however had much to be desired. The place was very busy, lots of expats/Americans in the restaurant.

Qf612D-Dq6RPdWHuxoPnSg.text: In London with a client and a colleague recommended this quaint spot for dinner and it didn't disappoint. Neighborhood feel with extremely good food. The place was bustling with trendy but not pretentious locals. Staff was very attentive and the food was ridiculous!  Prices are reasonable. I'll definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Pizza Il Bordello
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna Bolognese
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Bar located in the center of the restaurant

6yCN4d_g4-hvZ2GzQk4NCw.text: The food here was DELICIOUS! Very tasty Italian food, we tried the 4 cheese pasta with shrimp and the seafood entree, the portions are very big, you can have 1 meal for 2. The service is also very good, waiters were friendly and very Italian.

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Bruschetta
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Seafood entree
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. 4 cheese with shrimp

HbtwRwhfEZepa6pZ5cvB5Q.text: I had a the lasagna al forno it was amazingly delicious! Pure and authentic Italian food and atmosphere! Wow! Service was great! Food was good! And they gave me a lot of food too! I couldn't even finish my plate! Super Cheesy just how l love it! Definitely recommend this spot! C'est un endroit caché au bord de l'eau de Londres.

ujP87c05BNx-PJY5kOVCPQ.text: This was our last meal in London, and for our vacation,  and it was absolutley fantastic. One of the best Italian restaurants we've ever been to. They made me a four cheese pasta with shrimp dish that was  no longer on menu because I loved the look of another yelpers posted photo. So many restaurants wouldn't do something like this and they were more than accommodating. My wife had the baked house chicken with roast potatoes and I swear this was the best chicken we've ever had. It takes 30 minutes to prepare but it comes out with the greatest crispy thin breaded crust. It was amazing. The worst part of the meal is that we couldn't really take the left overs (portions are great size) because we were staying at a hotel. The service was also the best we had in London. Whatever you do go hear for dinner but probably make reservations. We ate here after seeing the Tower of London, it's only about 10 minutes away.

u3jEKIyjeQ4wzdPvJ-Az8A.text: In old school Wapping there lurks an old school restaurants with even old schooler waiters. Walking through the doors of Il Bordello, is like stepping out of the Delorian. Welcome to the 80s.The tables have wipe clean table cloths and are crammed so close to our neighbours, I thought we were on a double date.The waiters are all of a charming vintage. Bedecked in wine coloured waistcoats and matching red dickie bows, they also match the table cloths! They're a bit surly, in that way people didnt care about customer reviews in the 80s, when yelp wasn't even a twinkle in it's founder's eye. To be honest its refreshing and I bet with repeat patronage you can melt away the gruff exterior. With a smiley demeanour, I definitely elicited a sneaky cheeky wink from my waitor. Let the challenge commence.They must be doing something right, at 10pm on a Friday as we are finishing up our meal, more eager customers come flooding in.It is clear they have long established regulars who have been coming here nearly as long as the waiters have worked here. The crowd was a mix of older original Londoners and younger hipper newcomers. All itching for old fashioned Italian food.The restaurant delivers a nice hearty meal.  My pasta dish was pretty good. The pizza we ate was so so but blame it on the husband who always goes for margherittas. Portions were big, my side salad was generous. The house red was a bit tasteless for my buds though. We had a nice night out. It veers on the pricey side for what it is but if in the area it's worth checking out for a bit of time travel.

iiVxBk6jP7pNC4DK6bxdkg.text: The food is amazing! The only reason I give this place 4 instead of 5 because the customer service isn't all that great took too long to order food get water etc... overall great place to eat with American size portions!

zNhq4qwqMiPahkdcw9u-IA.text: Went there on a busy Saturday night around 8:30, the rush hour apparently.A large restaurant with a lot of tables and a gigantic list of meals (which most of the time is a bad sign but turned out great there.). A very old school Italian atmosphere with an army of waiters running around and yelling instructions loudly. Can't get more Italian that that.Had the Milanese scalop with a side of Bolognese spaghetti. The British couple next to us gagged when they saw the size of scalop which was indeed huge. And delicious, perfectly cooked and crusted. Also had some wine but can't really remember what it is, I was letting the wheel to somebody else for once. Apparently It's a place where a lot of people bring their dates. That night the other customers were couples or large tables of friends. Be careful, even on a Saturday night they close around 11, which is a hard concept to grasp for a Parisian night owl like myself.Il Bordello can get really loud so I would not recommend going there to have intimate conversations. The food makes up for it by far though. Can't go wrong with a family business Italian restaurant.

Sf3Au5hc8-drgR_4QfVnVw.text: If I could go 6 stars, I would.   If it's not my new favourite restaurant in London, it is certainly my favourite Italian.  And basically for one reason, the food.  It's in a sort of out of the way spot, as much as that is possible in the heart of London.  A friend who has been going there for 15 years took me otherwise I  wouldn't have ever seen it.  I am thankful he did!It's a basic decor, charming simple I will call it.  The service was exceptional.  They were all proper professional waiters that had worked there for years; it seemed a real family owned type place, which I believe it is.  What is clear is that they really care about the menu and the wine.  We started with a caprese salad and smoked salmon stuffed with mashed avocados, which were plentiful and amazingly good.   I need to emphasise that you should bring an appetite.  The portions are large. Then I had a spaghetti and meatball.  I wanted to keep it basic to see what they could do with it but their menu is anything but basic.   Anyway, the pasta was perfectly cooked, to the second, and the meatballs were huge and packed with flavour.  I can't believe that we got dessert but my friend insisted and I discovered why.   The profiteroles and tiramisu were the best I have had.  Light and not to sweet but still decadent.  What more can I say?  If this hasn't convinced you, I have failed this great restaurant.  Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom

KDUHrTuJoe_MFX1b9OQ2kQ.text: We went here after reading all the positive reviews with a group of 6 friends.We had an amazing time! The food is superb, the staff is very kind and in for a laugh. The portions are very big, but for us guys it was excellent. We had a wonderful evening and next time in London we will definitely come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Medaillon Poivre

1tcFNvUPSlB2XjUHgubYfw.text: Ughhhh the food here is extremely good and it's freshly prepared every time.The portions are huge and even when I'm the hungriest, I find it hard to finish my plate. This restaurant is always overcrowded but that usually is a good sign for quality food yaaaay. I would recommend booking a table in advance so you don't have to wait before filling your tummy.The staff is super friendly, but you'll be coming for the food of course. Pizza and pasta people will loooove it here.

sPMX0-HSdfrnRV3eX9A7XA.text: One of the best pasta and lasagna I ever had. The place is a little crowded and sometimes the witers are sometimes rude. But the food and the deserts are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. Best tagliatele al solmone

yi4t3iI5a72XwowavrwbEw.text: Yum! I never really go out for Italian food, so Il Bordello was a big treat!This place was totally packed full of people! It was a good thing we had a booking for the Friday night. My boyfriend and I wanted to try something new and we heard from friends that this place was a great little place in Wapping. We were not disappointed!It seems that the big speciality dishes here is the fish! Which I wish I ordered! I ordered calamari instead as I was in the mood. The food was hot, fresh and flavourful.  I had food envy of those all around us!  We saw lamb shoulder dishes leaving the kitchen that looked like it was going to fall off the bone. And the couple sitting next to is ordered pizzas covered in bright toppings.I would suggest to really look at the full menu and speciality menu, as well as your neighbours to make a decision! There is a lot to choose from! However, don't fret as all of it is amazing!

t2LYi6zfYaOQHp5E6JHGQQ.text: It's not often you see such cheerful and attentive waiting staff. Furthermore, they were all men over 50 years old.Lovely old fashioned Italian food. Not too pricey. Large portion. Great atmosphere because of the cheerful waiting staffs. I have been here 4 times now and will be back again soon.

odcG_hWJTG7Dxvwr63bYNw.text: highly recommend! was taken here by a friend who is a frequent customer and I now know why, not only was the food delicious, the constant customers lines attest to its capabilites. The food is scrumptious, with very large portions. For starters we had the garlic focaccia, our resembled a pizza pie with fresh garlic, olive oil and rosemary. Then we ordered the prima Riccardo piza which had tomato, mozarella, aubergines and parmesan and a pasta, spaghetti  gamberoni, prawns in prawn sauce with tomatoes garlic and parsley, for dessert the profiteroles. All were exceptional, I would highly recommend and you will have leftovers because portions are quite generous. Must try!

PSU1qv9tfCIYlVfGRm2Mbw.text: This place is fantastic! The minute you walk in you smell nothing but amazing food being prepared. The staff is amazingly friendly and fast. The list of specials makes you want to try each one!

photos.caption: Photo of Il Bordello - London, United Kingdom. The bruschetta is amazing! Great starter.
